snippet: Leaving a racecar to level a score is not unique to Kevin Ward Jr., who died Saturday after confronting Tony Stewart on the dirt racetrack at Canandaigua Motorsport Park.
abstract: Juliet Macur Sports of The Times column holds that death of race car driver Kevin Ward Jr, after emerging from his wrecked car apparently to confront Nascar driver Tony Stewart, highlights how confrontation has been part of auto racing for generations; Stewart, whose car struck and killed Ward, has been Nascar’s resident hothead and has often gotten out of his crashed race cars and wagged his finger at other drivers, warning them that a flogging could come for causing him to wreck.
lead_paragraph: Leaving a racecar to level a score is not unique to Kevin Ward Jr., who died Saturday after confronting Tony Stewart on the dirt racetrack at Canandaigua Motorsport Park.
